alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Forsyth (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 11:18AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Forsyth and northeastern Davidson Counties through 1145 AM EDT... At 1117 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Winston-Salem, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rainfall, lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Winston-Salem, Kernersville, Clemmons, Lewisville, Walkertown, Rural Hall, Stanleyville, Pfafftown, Sedge Garden and Donnaha. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
